Summary: I needed a place to stay locally for a few nights and found this one at a reasonable price.  Contrary to other reviews, my room was clean and comfortable.  Had a little sitting room with a tv, and a separate bedroom, also with tv.  The decor is dated, but it reminded me of the quaint little boutique hotels in Europe. The free wi-fi was reliable and parking was free.  Convenient walking distance to local eateries. There was a mini-fridge and a microwave oven.  Even though my room faced a busy street, the windows were good enough to mitigate the traffic noise. Free breakfast was less than satisfactory.  Some cereal, instant oatmeal packets, Cup-a-Noodles, two loaves of bread and a toaster. I never felt unsafe.  There was a homeless guy hanging out at the 7/11 across the street,
Room tip: Ask for a room toward the back of the hotel if you want to avoid street noise.

Summary: Do not stay here please. A police officer was looking for a fugitive at the motel.and told me not to stay there it is not safe. The neighborhood is not safe either. I was horrified that I could not find reservations at another motel and had to stay for the night.

Good location- near several freeways and old towne Orange.  Plenty of restaurants and coffee places just a few minutes away.  No frills but reasonable priced room.  Helpful reception staff let me check in early upon arrival.

This hotel was listed on the Wyndham hotel reward website.  The property was disgusting - the room had cockroaches, pubic hair on the bed sheets, blood splattered on the bath room walls, holes in the bed sheets, two large holes crudely repaired with putty plaster and no paint, black sharpy writing on the furniture, hair stuck on the bathroom walls were just a few of the first few items we noticed before we quickly left the room.  When returning the keys to leave the property, we saw three prostitutes in the parking lot entering hotel rooms on the property.  This hotel did not appear to be clean or safe.   And, the hotel and our room did not reflect the photos pictured on the website.

Summary Heading: looking for a low rate hotel?
Summary: nice place but deficient cleaning. I have to say that this is one of the lowest rate i could fine at internet, however I had to take some things that I dislike. Thinking that I was going to be in the parks from the morning till night it was not priority to take an expensive hotel

During my stay I felt safe and appreciated the professional yet friendly nature of all the staff. Location convenient to the highways and I visited the beach every day. LOVED the oval bath tub. Room felt clean and spacious. Perhaps not the comfiest bed but worked for me. I enjoyed the couch sitting area, desk, and brightness of the room. I will forever be gratefull for the man on call answering the phone and coming to helping at 2am when my key card didn’t open my door until I pressed more firmly. Remember to put down a plate before you push the “make pancakes” button!

The hotel stay was disgusting. I was bit by a spider and needed medical attention. I almost stepped on a drug needle. It was an unpleasant visit. My grandson was admitted to Choc so we stayed on an emergency visit. I wish I look into it further before driving from San Diego. Staff was rude as well. Location awful and rooms filthy

Summary Heading: OK place to lay  your head
Summary: The hotel is very conveniently located to St. Joseph's Hospital, which was my main reason in booking this location as my Mom is undergoing some treatments and I wanted to be close.  The room was clean and well maintained for being an older hotel, my bed was comfortable, everything worked and nothing was broken, and it was quiet.  Due to COVID, no breakfast, but also OK.  I needed to work from my room, and while I could get internet and work, there was not enough bandwidth to sustain the Zoom calls I needed to make, just an FYI for anyone needing to know that.
Room tip: I was on the first floor and I was OK with the location.

Summary: The hotel owners were not friendly, the sheets were torn and dirty, the noise levels were high, and the breakfast was the skimpiest we can recall at a hotel with juices, etc, not being refilled.  If you can stay elsewhere, I would advise it. The Best Western Orange just down the road is a better option.

I would come back.  Convenient location average maid service, Breakfast fine. Front desk lady very friendly. Staff overall was friendly. It was quiet and we slept well. Not the Taj Mahal but comfortable.

The hotel was an older facility but was well kept up. The room was clean, bed was comfortable, the A/C worked very well, bathroom clean and shower worked well. The tub was slippery so we had to put a hand towel in it to keep from slipping. Other than that we had not complaints.

For the cost of a night here, I only expect cleanliness and reasonable service. The room was certainly clean to my satisfaction and the staff I encountered were friendly and helpful. There was a minor problem with the TV remote but staff handled it effectively. The location was excellent for my needs.

This hotel is overpriced and an aged property. The room appeared to be straight out of 1975. The bed was lumpy and too soft. The ice vending room was next door and had a metal door that slammed all night long. The kicker was my second day, when I returned to my room after 12 hours of work, found it unmade and just went to sleep anyway. 50 minutes later, at 8:20 pm I was awakened by housekeeping wanting to refresh my room. At 8:20 pm!!!??? Never again and am done with Wyndham properties!

Keep the change and stay at motel 6. Cleanliness is an option here. Normally happy with days inn laquinta inn, but quite disappointed with maids. Its a safe hotel and i slept without any yelling but the boogers and stains on floor put me off. Nothing rotten in fridge or bad electronics, (staff great)- its just obviously maidservice is a low priority. I worked too early to get bfast- so have no input on that.

Summary Heading: Great if you're just looking for a place to sleep
Summary: 5/5 if you're just looking for a decent place to sleep at night. This was in a safe convient area. Hotel is very dated but was clean. If you're looking for a nice hotel this isnt for you but if you're just exploring the area or doing Disneyland (15 min drive) this is great especially for the price. Be aware if you check in late at night you have to ring a bell and use a tiny window since the inside is locked which I didnt like but during the day it's fine. Check out was very efficient.

Love the clean, convenient quick elevator. Beautiful laminate floors and very comfortable beds in very clean, well lit rooms. Your choice of 3 Internet secure networks. Vigilant  staff.  Breakfast was okay. Hotel is close to great shopping, resturants and a very nice fully stocked "7-11" right across the street. Quiet area. Great for 2 nights!! We'll be back.

For a overnight stay it was worth the price. Room was clean. Use of Uber and Lfty was very easy to visit Disney Downtown and was a very good price. Public transportation was close as well as places to eat.

I have stayed her at the Days Inn on multiple occasions now. Everytime, each experience has been the same... WONDERFUL! I would highly recommend this location to anybody traveling or local. The staff is friendly and polite and the rooms are clean and provide a secure feeling.

Wonderful area nice people cheap and low deposits and they care when ur in my situation by the supervisors of wyndam rewards lots of towels clean room everyday accommodations 100 + on that and staff 100+

It’s a motel, so I don’t expect 5-star luxury, but it was perfect for what I needed.  As a single woman I felt safe here. They also allowed me to check out at noon, which helped me a lot.  Breakfast was helpful too.

Our purpose to stay at this motel was to visit with friends, so the location was excellent for our needs.  The property seems to set in a nice neighborhood, but is off a busy main street.  I thought the staff was very nice, both in the office and on the property.  The motel is fairly close to freeways, stores, gas stations, and there are many eating establishments in the area.  The room we were given was very nice, but the laminated wood floor seemed like it could use a mop, although the light colored bathroom floor looked nice and clean.  The room we were given had a comfortable bed, a nice mini fridge, microwave and a nice TV.  We really enjoyed our stay.  I can't comment on room service or breakfast, as we had neither.  We stayed for 3 nights and since we don't change our

Dont waste your money staying here....i thought being a Wyhndam property it wouldve been a beautiful room (property) and it was NOT!   They beed to disinfect ALL the rooms and furniture...especially the bathrooms!! 😔

The beds had hair on them when we checked as well as burn holes on the sheets and comforter. Then upon putting my luggage away discovered stuff splashed all over walls in bathroom and bedroom and trash

I stayed at the Days Inn with my family of 5. Upon arrival there was visible dust, hair and trash in the guest room. The lobby/breakfast area was very small, dirty, and breakfast options were limited. Parking was convenient and the location is good. Other than that, I can’t really recommend this motel.

great customer service by staff. easy access to our room. The room was very clean and clean. the television worked very good and access to channels was easy through the remote control. the breakfast had great selections.

Very nice staff, beds could be firmer, in good location to 7-11, my daughters apt, mall etc. easy to get on freeway. We didn’t have room serviced while there, but needed extra towels. It would have been better if the maid service could speak some English

Summary Heading: Decent motel for the money, good location, good value
Summary: The hotel is a bit scruffy and worn, and the breakfast is limited (though the coffee was good!). The location is great -- long walk to Angels' Stadium, short drive to Disneyland and all that, plenty of eateries and shops and malls close by. Overall a good value for the money.

Clean, location was great and close to the area we needed to be at early and late. Staff was friendly and knowledgeable.  Seemed quick to act with the loudness of our neighbors.  I believe they called the police to have the removed.
I was impressed with how comfortable the beds were!  Not hard like most but soft enough to be comfortable..A great night sleep.
Manager Response: Thank you for your thoughts, we are proud to showcase our new Simmons Beautyrest mattresses specifically branded for our hotels.  They are very nice, I purchased extras for my personal residence as well.  I wish you well, and we hope to see you again soon.

Summary: We stayed here for two nights on Fri and Sat. Really liked the room. Good rate for a weekend stay. We went to Universal Studios and Disneyland.
Manager Response: Thank you for your thoughts and feedback, we hope you enjoyed your time in Southern California and would welcome you back soon!

Summary: Overall the room was satisfactory. The room seemed clean. I was surprised they had no local phone service, also, the phone cord broke, and I was unable to call the desk. They were accommodating with room placement request. The desk clerk was difficult to understand. He spoke too fast when answering the phone, so I had to have repeat everything he said.
Manager Response: Hi Mark,  Thank you for your feedback, we have corrected the issue with the broken phone cord and appreciate your understanding.  I've also spoken to the staff to ensure that they communicate with guests more clearly.  We appreciate your business and hope you will return soon.

Summary: For the first time I received an upgrade on my room, a perk for Diamond Level Members that up until now has never happened.  I was upgraded from a King to a King Suite which had an oversized tub, great shower head, pullout sofa bed, and 2 TVs.  A King bed and TV in 1 room with door, and sofa bed, TV, fridge, and microwave in the other.  It looked newly remolded with a wood floor.  But now for the down side, why do guests put their feet/shoes on the wall?  There were many scuff marks on the wall, squished raisins on the floor, hair in the bathroom, and a dirty window.  I had a lot of nervous energy and cleaned it all myself.  I'd recommend the place but followup with management if the room isn't clean.
Manager Response: Thank you for your thoughts and your feedback.  I'm glad we could accommodate you.  As of your review I am ordering our housekeeping staff to review proper cleaning procedures so we do not miss these items in the future.  We appreciate your business and hope you will visit us again soon.

Summary: I was in town with my husband and the hotel is at a good location. This place is good for a quick getaway.
Manager Response: Thank you for your thoughts and feedback.  We enjoyed serving you and hope you will come see us again soon.

Summary Heading: Very poor quality for the price.  Very poor value...
Summary: Very poor quality for the price.  Very poor value.  Bathroom in bad shape, exposed sprinkler heads, needs painting
Manager Response: Hi Amber,  I'm sorry we didn't meet your expectations, we are about 50% through a complete remodel effort and it sounds like you may have been in one of the rooms we have not yet had a chance to work on.  I hope next time you will give us another chance to prove we are the best value in town.  Tip: Ask for a newer remodeled room upon check-in :), although we try and put our guests into the newer rooms first.

Summary Heading: Great stay at the Days Inn Orange Anaheim.
Summary: Thank you Days Inn, in Orange Anaheim. Your service experience was outstanding, and a great value within our budget. We hope Days Inn keeps up their great service, and hospitality with future guest. Thank you.
Manager Response: Thank you for your thoughts and your feedback, we hope to see you back soon!

Summary: it wasn't very clean, there were ppl out in the parking lot and stairs all through the night smoking cigarettes noisy.  We could smell cigarette smoke in our room we had a 8 month old in room with us. I could not sleep because of the noise. I did not feel safe. Def would not pay 120.00 to stay there again.
Manager Response: I'm sorry you had a negative experience with us, we aim for an environment higher than what you have described and we will continue to improve anywhere needed.  Thank you for your thoughts and your feedback, we would welcome you to give us another try when you are in town, please message me directly and i'll make sure you are taken care of on your next visit.

Summary: Great place to stay.  Very quite right across the street is 7 Eleven, taco bell, Carl's Jr and CVS. Housekeeping are very friendly and helpful. Definitely going back again thanks guys.
Manager Response: Thank you for your thoughts and feedback, it was a pleasure serving you and we hope you will come visit us again soon.

Summary Heading: Business travel gem, better inside than out.
Summary: Rooms are updated, clean and convenient, even if the outside is a mid-century relic. Free Parking (a premium in this neighborhood), secure location, well maintained elevator, and newly refurbished rooms. Very helpful and professional staff, and High Access internet, perfect for professionals, or those visiting the nearby hospitals. Walking distance to convenience stores, and fast food restaurants.  Perfect for the traveller escaping SoCal traffic, and those in need for a clean safe space doing business in Orange.
Manager Response: Thank you for your comments and feedback.  We look forward to serving you again soon.

Summary: My room was not clean. Dirt fingerprints everywhere. Burn holes on comforter, and small bugs crawling in bathroom. Very poor experience. Continental breakfast offered sunny delight, instead of real orange juice. Bring your own cleaning sanitation supplies, or don't stay here. Cleaning staff was friendly, accommodating, and understanding of my complaints. Front desk staff not too friendly and welcoming. Overall a bad experience for the price.
Manager Response: Dear guest, thank you for giving us a chance.  You will be happy to hear that we are currently remodeling and changing furniture including the couch!  We hope that you will give us another chance soon, we are had very good feedback recently with regard to the new renovations and furniture additions.  With regard to staff being courteous, I will direct your feedback to them and we will improve our weaknesses.  If you are ever back in town, we hope that you will give us another chance to show you our new enhancements, just make sure you ask for an upgraded/newer room while checking in!

Summary Heading: Bad area   Prostitea walking outside ,  people firing screaming , scary okase
Summary: Good price bad area.   ,  perplexing fitting screaming wake me up couple times. ,  wife was afraid ,  I when out , come back later. Prostitus walking outside , please need security patrol to help keep parole out property

My stay was horrible, so bad in fact I showered and left. I am recently a homeless disabled veteran, I can not believe how I was treated. While checking in nothing was handed to me instead tossed in the counter rudly, the only reason I continued with my check in was because I had not had a real shower in 4 days. If it wasn't for that and that alone I would have saved my money and been on my way. The front desk clerk was apsalitly horriable, rude and no customer service what so ever. The few hours I was there other guest where loud, rude and seemed more permanent. The beds where nasty and that's coming from a guy who was dirty. I didn't get wifi access or anything. Also was put on the second floor and told there was no first floor openings yet I seen a vacant room, i am disabled

If you don't read further, know that they put a $400 hold on our account! I called ahead to make sure I would be able to use one card to book the room and pay with another one at check in, because my mom offered to pay for the room. They said I could, so I booked the room using my bankcard. When we checked in, my mom signed an invoice for the room on her card. A couple of days later, I noticed that my bankcard had been charged for the full stay plus a surprise $400 hold. My mom said her card was also charged. This put our bank account into the red for the rest of our trip. After an hour on the phone, the hotel reversed the charge (which of course would take several days) and agreed to take $20 of one of the nights. Still, that was less than the $36 the bank charged us in
Dirty. Undesirable characters hanging out at entrance. Floors dirty in room and the couch was grossly stained. Not worth $100. What you would expect for $39.99
Manager Response: Dear guest, thank you for giving us a chance.  You will be happy to hear that we are currently remodeling and changing furniture including the couch!  We hope that you will give us another chance soon, we are had very good feedback recently with regard to the new renovations and furniture additions.  If you are ever back in town, we hope that you will give us another chance to show you our new enhancements, just make sure you ask for an upgraded/newer room while checking in!   If possible, please send me a message with information regarding your stay so I can investigate your visit and review for improvements!

Summary Heading: Pulled in and immediately locked the doors. No pool. Room damp and dirty. Couch looked like it came off the trash truck.
Summary: Neighbors were yelling that  they was gonna kill someone and from the condition of the area - I honestly wondered when the last murder occurred. I asked us just to look at the room and we did. Dirty, stinky, stains on beds and couch! Was booked for 7 nights. I paid for one night (because it was too late to cancel) NEVER STAYED THE NIGHT, canceled the rest of the planned stay and put the pedal to the metal and left that dump in my dust!
Manager Response: We're sorry to hear about your experience with us. It sounds like you may have been unluckily placed in one of our older rooms. We are in process of upgrading all of our rooms. If you are ever back in town, we hope that you will give us another chance to show you our new enhancements, just make sure you ask for an upgraded/newer room while checking in!   If possible, please send me a message with information regarding your stay so I can investigate your visit and review for improvements!

Summary: Hotel properties should never be able to charge rates based on market demand if their property quality is not up to an expected standard.  The condition of the property such as the room was poor, with the exception of the provision of clean bedding, towels and fresh toiletries.  The paint, carpet, furniture condition was in need of restoration or replacement.  The noise from the road was excessive, the room was saturated with smoke, which in turn saturated our clothing with smoke.  I requested a non-smoking room, but was not provided.  These properties either need to invest in refurbishment or never be allowed to charge the rates that can be demanded when room demand is high.
Manager Response: We're sorry to hear about your experience with us. It sounds like you may have been unluckily placed in one of our older rooms. We have upgraded half our rooms earlier this year and will continue upgrading the remaining as time allows. If you are ever back in town, we hope that you will give us another chance to show you our new enhancements, just make sure you ask for an upgraded/newer room while checking in!    If possible, please send me a message with information regarding your stay so I can investigate your visit and review for improvements!

Summary: I had some of my luggage stolen from my vehicle and when I had told the front​desk and asked if I could see the footage from their security cameras they told me that there was nothing they could do because where I parked was not in view of any of the cameras, why don't they then have security guards or why can't they put up another camera if they already know there is a blind spot, what if someone were to get mugged or raped what then, are they just going to say "sorry you were in a blind spot, there is nothing we can do."
Manager Response: Dear B2357ULkeving,  So sorry to hear about your luggage.  Would you kindly message me privately and let me know the specifics of what happened and in which area?  We will definitely look into this and see what corrections need to be made.  I hope everything else was to your satisfaction.

Summary: The only advantage is that it is very close to Disney. Rooms are ok, not the cleanest. The perimeter is very dirty.. that flows into rooms! People smoke just outside, so not very helpful even if you have a non smoking room
Manager Response: We're sorry to hear about your experience with us. It sounds like you may have been unluckily placed in one of our older rooms. We have upgraded half our rooms earlier this year and will continue upgrading the remaining as time allows. If you are ever back in town, we hope that you will give us another chance to show you our new enhancements, just make sure you ask for an upgraded/newer room while checking in!  If possible, please send me a message with information regarding your stay and investigate the external areas around the room!

Summary: Lets start with the little couch that was stained all over.  Then the wall behind the couch was dirty as well.  The air conditioning unit looked like it was 30 years old.  I just couldn't shake the feeling that everything in there was not clean.  It made me feel uncertain about the bed and sheets as well.  The continental breakfast was a joke.  They actually had Cup of Noodles (chicken and shrimp) as part of their offerings.  It was very minimal, low quality 'food'.   The 'dining area' was just two tables set up in the entryway by the check in counter.  I would not suggest this place to anyone.
Manager Response: Dear 390claudinem,  We're sorry to hear about your experience with us.  It sounds like you may have been unluckily placed in one of our older rooms.  We have upgraded half our rooms earlier this year and will continue upgrading the remaining as time allows.  Rest assured, we gold-standard industrial detergents from EcoLab for our sheets to keep them fresh and clean.  Some of our guests actually do enjoy hot soup in the Morning and find that to be an added value.  If you are ever back in town, we hope that you will give us another chance to show you our new enhancements, just make sure you ask for an upgraded/newer room while checking in!

Summary: The staff is very accommodating, the room was recently renovated, the location (nearness to dining and businesses) was what we desired. Even being near a hospital and on Main St., the noise was not disruptive.
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback!  It is appreciated and we hope to welcome you back soon!

Summary: I forgot to turn in the room badges after I leaving, I called the front desk that she was nice to say it is ok.
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback, please do let us know anything we can do to improve the quality of your next visit!  We are listening!

Summary: The hotel, is undergoing a refresh of the rooms.  The lady that words at the front desk is very Sweet and friendly. Easy access to freeways from the hotel.
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback, please do let us know anything we can do to improve the quality of your next visit!  We are listening!

Summary Heading: The mattress was terrible you couldo feel all the wires. There was so much noise all night, the rooms were dirty
Summary: The mattress was terrible you couldo feel all the wires. There was so much noise all night, the rooms were dirty
Manager Response: We're sorry to hear about your experience with us.  It sounds like you may have been unluckily placed in one of our older rooms.  We have upgraded half our rooms (including the mattresses!) earlier this year and will continue upgrading the remaining as time allows.  Rest assured, we gold-standard industrial detergents from EcoLab for our sheets to keep them fresh and clean.  If you are ever back in town, we hope that you will give us another chance to show you our new enhancements, just make sure you ask for an upgraded/newer room while checking in!

Summary: I would not recommend this motel.  Pictures in internet are deceiving.  Our bathroom was less than desireable.....hair all over the place, dirty walls that are screaming to be painted and the caulking was moldy....not to mention the water was cloudy white and lime/calcium deposit on sink fixture. Just aweful!
Manager Response: We're sorry to hear about your experience with us.  It sounds like you may have been unluckily placed in one of our older rooms.  We have upgraded half our rooms earlier this year and will continue upgrading the remaining as time allows.  If you are ever back in town, we hope that you will give us another chance to show you our new enhancements, just make sure you ask for an upgraded/newer room while checking in!  If possible, please send me a message with information regarding your stay, we will investigate and ensure that these issues are corrected ASAP!

Summary Heading: Best place if you don't get any walkable hotel from Disney
Summary: I was looking for hotel which is very near to Disney so that i can walk to the park from Hotel. As i searched just few days ago most of the hotels are sold out and those  are  available they are very expensive. So i found this hotel which is 15 minutes away from Disney (the time can extend to 30 minutes, while entering the park if it is a weekend due to long queue of cars). We used lyft, it cost $12 to reach and while coming back it took $8.  I was in a king room. The room,service,internet,breakfast is awesome.  I saved some money  comparing 1 day cost in near by hotel with this hotel adding lyft + hotel charge. So if you are not getting near hotel to disney then you can consider this hotel as you will save some money.
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback, please do let us know anything we can do to improve the quality of your next visit!  We are listening!

Summary Heading: Place is awesome, little far from Disneyland
Summary: We went for a family trip. The hotel and service is awesome. A little far from Disneyland. You need to take a cab approx $10-$14 to reach to disney. So if you need a comfort stay and not getting any hotels which is walkable from Disney; i would recommend them this hotel.
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback, please do let us know anything we can do to improve the quality of your next visit!  We are listening!

Summary: The hotel was great!  It was very clean and recently up-graded.  The bathroom was wonderful, with a huge tub to soak in.   The room was spacious and very comfortable.  It has easy access from the street and is very well kept outside also.  Plenty of parking as well.  The service was excellent.  The staff  is very kind, polite and helpful.   We will definitely recommend this place.  It is very conveinent to the freeways as well.
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback, please do let us know anything we can do to improve the quality of your next visit!  We are listening!

Summary: Check in was very pleasant. Requested first floor room was available. Parking was very good and secure. Had to leave early so we missed breakfast. Only problem was a very weak internet connection.
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback, we will investigate the weak internet connection!  Please do let us know anything else we can do to improve the quality of your next visit!  We are listening!

Summary: Overall the room was clean, well stocked with coffee, towels and the sort of things needed for a comfortable overnight stay. My chief complaint is, I was given a smoking room when I'm not a smoker. I told them I didn't want a smoking room and they did not comply. The entire time I tried to rest during the night, Every inhale smelled of smoke. I don't smoke, and I have asthma (this was not a pleasant experience.
Manager Response: I'm so sorry to hear about your experience.  Please message me directly with your information regarding your stay and give us a chance to correct our failures.  Thank you!.

Summary: The place was nice. We stayed there b/c of the close proximity to CHOC. It had laminate wood floors, nice and clean. I gave it 4 stars b/c they were doing construction and it was right by my window. Parking was narrow and not enough spaces for a 3 story building. The pillows are square and the size of couch pills.
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback, please do let us know anything we can do to improve the quality of your next visit!  We are listening!

Summary Heading: don't expect a lot when you don't pay a lot
Summary: we were just looking for an inexpensive place to sleep near Chapman University and got exactly that.  it was a bummer that the bathroom fan was broken and apparently had been for sometime (mildew on the bathroom ceiling).  probably will try a different spot next time, if they could do one thing, I would say update your bathrooms, if not, then give them a really deep cleaning.

The personnel were great.  Our room wasn't ready when we arrived.  We had to wait about 20 minutes.  It met our purposes but for the price of this room, we expected a little bit more!  The small refigerator made noises 24 hrs a day!  We could hear when guests made noises in their room.

Well, I was i a pinch. needed a place to stay quick. So, I had a suite facing 7-11, on the 3rd. floor. It was allright, however; I did note individuals loitering in cars, talking, smoking cigarettes, both nights I was there. I witnessed a lovers spat, which I was waiting for the police to show up. I can tell when people do, or are "high" on meth.  I think this whole motel was "spun out"  Now the room was fine, Big bathroom, separate sitting area. The futon was broken , I was beyond obvious, that somehow the center was compromised. When sitting, I sank all the way to the floor. Whatever, it was $133 with tax.
Nice friendly staff, clean rooms, quite,  secluded, romantic. Could serve a better breakfast! But it was ok

The room was clean and complete with toiletries, stuff we need.  But, the price was expensive for just a room accommodation.  Also, we did not have a good sleep, since you can hear the noise outside.  Noise coming from the people who are also checked in and the cars passing on the road.  And, as early as 4-5am, we got awake because of these super loud footsteps where we do not know where it came from.  We asked the personnel in the lobby, but she said, she do not know too.

Summary Heading: I won't be staying there again
Summary: When I arrived, there were 2 Police cars there.  I was able to check in a little early, though.  The room itself was "OK", but hadn't been (thoroughly) cleaned in some time (dust/grime in the Fan Vent).  The Alarm clock was making a noise that I could not make stop.  I ended up unplugging it.  When I woke up in the morning, I went to make some coffee, but the coffee pot hadn't even been rinsed out.  I asked the front desk to make sure that the coffee pot was cleaned and the clock replaced by the time I got back in the evening.  The clock hadn't been replaced and the coffee pot was still dirty.  When I went to the desk to complain, there was a different person, so I explained what had happened and she apologized, gave me a NEW clock and a NEW carafe for the coffee and (at my

Summary Heading: Nice enough spot close to Disneyland
Summary: My regular spots were booked so I selected this location based on price and distance from Disneyland.  I really liked the location.  Nice shopping center across the street with good food options.  The area seemed pleasant.  There is no pool area its a sitting area.  The internet was good, and the rooms were very nice.  No noise that i could tell.  You will need a car to get to Disneyland but since you take a short freeway hope the time is the same as some places that are a few blocks south.  I would stay here again as a back-up to my "usual" places.
Manager Response: Thank you for being the best part of our business!  We look forward to striving for excellence and hope to earn a spot on your "usual" list.  Please let us know how we can make you more comfortable, we are listening!

Summary Heading: Very dirty and out dated place.
Summary: One of the Televisions was not working and when I went down to talk to person in front desk, she did not beleive me until I got very firm with her.  The sheets were stain and looked dirty, in the bathroom the toilet was dirty and the wall in the bath tub had hair all over and hand printed on the walls with make up.  The floor was dirty and no airconditioning in both bedrooms, only in leaving room and very poor quality.  Very dissapointed with the hygene and out dated.
Manager Response: I would like to personally apologize for the series of unfortunate incidences that you experienced during your stay with us. I will look into each issue that you have noted, in an attempt to correct and improve our hotel services.  Please note that we are in the process of a restoration project with 45% of our rooms already re-moderned and hope to have 100% of the rooms completed by the end of the year.  I hope you will give us another chance in the near future.

Summary: It was scary arriving late at night. There were two men smoking weed outside and two younger kids that were walking around the parking lot and kept looking at us as we checked in. It seemed like some of the people lived there as in their actual home. It didn't seem very safe.    The same Asian lady that checked us in at 2AM checked us out at 12PM which seemed kind of weird that she had worked a 12 hour shift.
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback.  We are sorry to hear your experience was less than perfect.  Your concerns have been noted and shared with appropriate staff.  We will continue to strive for a more pleasant environment.  Please note we are in the middle of a large restoration project with over 45% of our rooms having been re-moderned, I hope that you will give us another chance once we complete our renovations.

Summary: It was not expected the surroundings of the Inn. The kids did not feel comfortable or safe going out of the room alone. With rollaway bed it tight getting around.  Only one night helped.
Manager Response: I apologize if your experience did not meet your expectations.  Our location's strengths are definitely more location and convenience based than resort-like.  Thank you for your feedback, management is listening and improving.

Summary Heading: Not the best not the worst
Summary: The room was clean and fresh.  It was noisy due to traffic volume on street.  The plumbing was inadequate.
Manager Response: Hello Sandra, we apologize for the traffic noise and plumbing issues.  We will look into solutions for reducing traffic noise, if you would be so kind as to message us with the room number you stayed in or registration information I would love to have the plumbing taken care of.  Thank you!

Summary: Getting in and out of parking lot is a hassle and the parking lot is small but it's clean inside the rooms, and that's my concern. No gluten free options for breakfast
Manager Response: Thank you for visiting us Ashley, we will keep look for gluten free options for breakfast in the near future.  We appreciate the suggestion!

Summary: Thank you to the staff in the office! They were very accommodating and helpful. I got the room for my girlfriends daughter and the management was glad to help me out. She needed a place because her mother was stuck out of town.
Manager Response: The staff would like to thank you for being the best part of our business!

Summary Heading: You get what you pay for
Summary: The room was decent the price was ok but the area was terrible. There was a meth pipe outside of our window.... so that just tells you what type of people are nearby.
Manager Response: I'm sorry that you had to experience that, we continue to strive for a better environment.  We are 45% complete in a re-modernization of our rooms and will continue to improve.  Thanks for giving us a chance!

Summary: Place is old, did not feel safe but it is on a main road and it wasn't too bad.  Windows don't have real locks and breakfast bar isn't too great.
Manager Response: Thank you for giving us a chance.  I am proud to announce we are 45% complete of a restoration project that will re-modernize our rooms.  We hope you will give us another chance in the future!

Summary: I was on a budget so the price drew me in.  Wyndhym franchises can vary greatly in quality.  I've stayed in well kept Travelodge properties and ran down Days Inn properties.  This one falls in the later.  It was clear that the owners only care about profits and not guest comfort.  I did have a somewhat updated bathroom.  That was the highlight of the room.  The rest of it was a little dirty feeling and the bed was not very comfortable.  It wasn't the worst hotel bed I've slept in, but far from the best.  The outside was a little scary with some of the guests that were obviously long term "extended stay" tenants.  If the owners spent as much money on the rooms as they do the security cameras they would have a decent property!
Manager Response: We are so sorry that you had a negative experience here.  We are in the middle of a restoration project with new wood floors being put into all the rooms along with bathroom upgrades and as of late July we are 45% complete.  We hope that you will give us another chance soon, we will not disappoint!

Summary: I took my family to Disneyland for 8 nights. 7 of those nights I stayed at the Dolphins Cove Worldmark resort.  I had one night that we had to find alternate accommodations because of the availability of the rooms there. I searched online and there were a few nice hotels and then when I called Wyndham they suggested this one the Days Inn. We got to the Days Inn about midnight .  You have to buzz through the class to get into the small office.  The lady was OK not very friendly and said there was breakfast in the morning. We got to bed about 1 AM, the room was below average.  They did not have portable cribs for our toddler. We got up in the morning got ready to go get what probably would look like a bagel. We got into the office about 9:10 in the morning and she informed us that

DO NOT STAY HERE! There are full-service hotels just a few minutes drive away (closer to Disney, in fact they have free shuttles there) that have much nicer rooms, many amenities  - pools, fitness centers, restaurants, full breakfast buffet - and much better service, for only slightly higher rates.  Plus, in our room and in our friends' room, we were subjected to the constant JACKHAMMER-LIKE noise of the hotel's ancient industrial washing machine all day long,  starting at 7AM on a Sunday! A freight train rolling through your room non-stop would be quieter. We went online and found a great deal at a full-service hotel for a much, much nicer room. Well worth just a few dollars more. We won't return to the Days Inn.

Very basic but added accommodations, including refrig. microwave, passcode for wifi [didnt use]  Beds  were comfortable. Our room was clean.   Both front counter employees were wonderful.  Housekeeping was friendly.  Hotel centrally located to everything.
The carpet was dirty, there was underwear hanging on the shower rod, found a pacifier on the floor by the corner of the bed
Owner is updating all rooms.  Very nice job. Staff is super.  If coming to OC for Dr at OC Ortho Institute, it is across street AND HANDY!

From the moment we checked in we were disappointed in this hotel.  We had to wake up someone to check us in at 2 in the afternoon.  The room was not very clean, and they didn't clean it 2 of the 3 days we stayed.  The day they did clean it, they didn't leave any towels.  The breakfast was all packaged food-- boxed drinks and packaged sweet rolls.  Our daughter just moved to that neighborhood, but we will choose another hotel for our next visit-- even if it is more expensive.

The attendee was incredibly rude, and when I asked to talk to a supervisor, she yelled at me "I'm the supervisor!" plain awful. She was ready to throw my credit card at me. Overall, the hotel was old and the room smelled funny. I had a much much better experience at the Days Inn outside of Disneyland. So dissappointing.
The bathroom was filthy  - there were phone numbers written on the inside of the bathroom door and dead bugs on the floor.

I had called to book a room for my husband and I and when I called I told them to find me a room where I will be able to check out the next day. And the customer service said okay I checek in at 4 am and literally got kicked out that same day ay check out 11:am. Worse day ever after a 3 hour drive to orange county.
Getting the room could've been the the tricky part but Eva worked really hard and diligently to make it all happen and I appreciate it. The room was lovely and the continental breakfast was great!

I booked a room, then used my points for a couple nites, but change my mind only use for one night, i called the Wydum to make the change they went and charge my card again now causing a overdraft on my bank account even the front desk person where i was staying at tried to explain to the CSR it wasnt nessiary for them charge me again since my card was already.now i have to wait 7 busness days before i can get my money bank into my account after all the screw ups and being a gold card member the Wydum should e-mailing me apologizing and giving me a free night.

Summary Heading: As in all business you generally get what you pay for. The...
Summary: As in all business you generally get what you pay for. The grounds around motel need a lot of cleaning.

Summary Heading: Nice Manager, Big Room, Great Location, Dirty Rug
Summary: The hotel was well located and the manager and his wife were extremely accommodating. The room was big, though a bit old. If the rug has been cleaner and the housekeeping more thorough, I would say this is a decent three-star (not two) hotel.

tired old motel, a/c unit had to be removed and replaced that evening in room 303, the bathroom tub was corroded and tub handle rusted. the only good thing was it was clean and the bed was comfy. TV's worked good.

We stayed here for Chapman move-in in August.  We booked the hotel because the website says it's .4 mile from Chapman (it's farther than that).  The rate was good, but it's not walking distance to the school.  The quality is just ok. Don't sacrifice hotel quality because you think you're staying right next to Chapman.

Summary Heading: The front desk lady was very friendly during check in. The...
Summary: The front desk lady was very friendly during check in. The room was clean, beds comfortable. The only complaint I have was the price of hotel, I think $144 a night was a little high .

Hotel is so dirty. Carpet was so dirty and if you walk you will have a black feet. Room are tiny and small not as expected and shown in the pictures. Two tables for breakfast area, with nothing to present for a continental breakfast. Breakfast area dirty and ants around the food area. Overall experience

Summary Heading: nice quiet hotel close to Angels stadium
Summary: We enjoyed the location of this hotel, nice and quiet neighborhood within reasonable distance of all the places we planned on visiting. The only thing that would have made our stay better would be more options in the continental breakfast as well as faster internet...we are not from the area and got behind schedule searching for directions online because the service was so slow.

I got a charged 4 times for one hotel room and got ripped off!! I will never stay at a days inn ever again. We asked for extra towels and never got them in the 3 days we were there.. Also tweakers were all around us...

Summary Heading: Needs work. Take a lesson from Best Western continental...
Summary: Needs work. Take a lesson from Best Western continental breakfast yours is sad. Bathrooms need cleaning TV in livingroom was broken and we weren't told about it had to let them know.

Summary Heading: The only problem we encountered was a lady knocking on our...
Summary: The only problem we encountered was a lady knocking on our door at 4am asking for some guy. She sounded highly intoxicated and we had to repeat over and over that she had the wrong room before she finally left. It was a bit unsettling. Also there was a wrecked vehicle parked in the lot that appeared to have been there awhile. In addition there was a van that although wasn't wrecked appeared to have been sitting there awhile so again a bit unsettling. We weren't sure if people were living in some of the rooms or what.

I don't even know where to start. The room  was dirty, no smoke detector, holes in the bathtub, screws sticking out of the light sockets and a microwave that had been either in a fire There were also powerstrips hanging down the appliances and we couldn't make outgoing phone calls. We felt unsafe and left as soon as possible.

Summary Heading: I needed to crash for one night and the Day's Inn was a...
Summary: I needed to crash for one night and the Day's Inn was a perfect solution. It was a great value for the rate I paid. If you're picky about everything you won't be happy here. The room was clean and had internet. I was happy.
Overall THE Experience could of been better. Now I can't complain the people at the office were great, but I went home with flee bites. Yuck! And I'm pregnant.  Not cool
The staff was helpful and professional but the rooms carpet was disgusting. stepped out of the shower, dried off and the short walk to the bed literally left my feet covered in mud!

I would not stay at this location again paying the rate I'm paying I shouldn't have to provide house cleaning before my stay.  The restroom n sink had brown stains as well as the table stand n coffee tables n the room.  The radio was making static sounds throughout the night.  We had to unplug the radio(clock) to sleep. The phone was not working n cannot connect to any wifi.  Guest services was contacted n aware of this issue.  It was not a pleasant stay.

The room was very clean and staff was very pleasant. The room definitely needs some updates. Electrical outlets were not sufficient to hold plugs. Could not get TV to work. It may have been unplugged but could not get to the plug and the plug that was available was full of plugs from microwave and light. Had to move coffee pot into bathroom to work. Some lights had bulbs missing. Would probably not stay there again. Sorry

The room was dirty, TV's did not work. Maid brought new towels and no toilet paper. We had to use kleenex . Someone left their underwear in the room. Shower and tub dirty with bottle cap on the bath tub ledge. We won't stay there again.

The staff was very friendly, but the property itself was not great.  It was the last hotel in the are for Disneyland.  We did have free parking however the suite that we paid 60 extra for was dirty and had no hot water.  We kept having to ask for things.  Eva and her husband were friendly and accommodated us as much as they could.  I rather pay more for a hotel then cheaper for a bad hotel.

Summary Heading: I would not stay here again!
Summary: This Days Inn was a huge disappointment.  I needed to book a hotel in Orange that was close to where we had some business to address.  There is not a lot to choose from and most other places were booked.  Given the available options, I thought the Days Inn was my best bet - a national chain right?   I am being nice giving it 2 stars - that is only because the room did work for us and we needed to stay an extra day and they made that work.  Other than that, the service was lacking.  On the plus side - We were in a suite and it was rather large - so space was good. Location for our needs in Orange was good, we could walk to much of what we needed. Reasonably quiet, as we were in the back. Cleaner was nice and kept us in clean towels  USA today was available at desk if you went and

Summary Heading: Disappointed!! NOT A FAMILY ORIENTED PLACE!!
Summary: Our first night was ok. When we got there, they told us the carpet had been steamed cleaned so the carpet was wet. Throughout our stay our feet and socks got all black and gross, so we had to wear our shoes. Then the following day,  some guy was next door to us and he put the music full blast, was all high,  kept going in and out of the room. He was making all sorts of crazy noises, and with 2 children in my room, we were freaked out. The cops came a couple of times, but nothing was done. We didn't feel comfortable staying another day, so we checked out 1 day early, and got our money back. Not family friendly at all!!! Breakfast was a joke, boxed pastries and juice was it!
I thought the bed was comfortable. The room needed work - there is no counter space AT ALL in the bathroom. Hard to set up makeup, etc

Summary Heading: Close to the Block and Metrolink, No pool. Basic room with...
Summary: Close to the Block and Metrolink, No pool. Basic room with Micro and Fridge. Dont be late for breakfast, it's gone.  Need basic stay, not very expensive, book it.

Summary Heading: Days Inn staff were nice, friendly and helpful.Room was...
Summary: Days Inn staff were nice, friendly and helpful. Room was average; nothing overly outstanding, but nothing bad...stay / room was good. Towels changed and bed made daily. Bathroom, bed and room was clean and neat.

the bathroom toilet was not securely fastened in there and it just wasn't the type of hotel that you would expect from days and um I probably wouldn't go back to that one if I'm going back out to Santa Ana again

Summary Heading: It was good for the cost.  Just staying one night is a lot...
Summary: It was good for the cost.  Just staying one night is a lot different than staying several days.  I didn't know there was a breakfast or I would have taken part of it.

We needed a place to stay for a funeral close by. Not knowing the area, someplace inexpensive for one night's stay. I picked this motel because it was close to everything needed in an unfamiliar area. The price was right, good remodel on an older motel, small but very clean. Coffee and danish for breakfast? Don't bother, good resturants (especially Mexican) down the street.

Place was ok and good for a short trip. The beds were hard though so if you are used to a pillowtop bed then this is not the bed for you. If you want to sleep inside this is good for you but its a no-frills hotel.

I have used this location several times for week long visits to Orange County. It is relatively quiet or as quiet as you could expect for something on Main Street. They have been trying to upgrade this location for a while , but it seems it's taking a long time. If you are not spending a lot of time in your room, then it works well as a motel venue. The proximity of a wide range of restaurants from Carl's Jr. to Manhattan Steakhouse (really upscale) make it ideal for me. Being almost next door to Childrens Hospital of Orange County is ideal for a visitor. It's a good value if you pinch pennies when traveling. Staff is friendly and helpful but I rarely need anything.

Summary Heading: I reserved a handicap room 3 months in advance then...
Summary: I reserved a handicap room 3 months in advance then confirmed on phone 2 weeks prior. No handicap room when we got there. It had been given out already! This made stay very difficult for our handicapped lady.

It looked decent on the outside. When we checked in the guy didn't even seem like he cared. When we asked for help with a taxi, it felt like we were treated like idiots. My room looked like it was cleaned but my sister's room still had blonde hair (our hair is black) on the bed. The microwaves and fridges looked like they were going to break down. The lights worked in my room, but not in my sister's. We only stayed one night and it was after a Dave & Busters drunken night of fun so when we got back we didn't care that the room was gross or broken. Breakfast was okay: instant oatmeal, instant noodle cups, danishes or something like that... With juice and I think there was coffee too but I don't drink it so I didn't bother looking.

Normally, I am pleased with DaysInn.  However this time I was disappointed.  There was blood on the toilet paper; the hide-a-bed couch folded up on one of our ladies in our group.  The people were kind and courteous.  They met our needs very quickly.  We had a suite--the bedroom did not have the cooler.  We had to keep the first room very cold to keep the bedroom, even mildly cool.

I don't get why all the bad reviews on this place.  I have stayed in two star hotels that are way worse than this one.  The room was well kept, not small at all. Comes with a fridge and microwave. The TV is a up to date flat screen.  Housekeeping did a better job than a lot of 4 star hotel housekeeping does that I have witnessed.    I had some trouble with the internet but the staff was very nice and helpful on getting it working right.  The place could use some work I do agree with that especially the outdoor seating area and the vending machine being more stocked up.

This particular Days Inn was older.  It was clean enough, but I had mixed feelings about the room size.  The room seemed smaller than other Days Inns that I've stayed at.  One of the beds was so close to the A/C unit that my bed covers were moist from the condensation.  The only thing that did make up for the stay was the very pleasant manager.  I won't, however, be staying at another Days Inn.  My last two stays were just too disappointing.  The obvious wear and tear on these facilities is obvious even to an untrained eye.  The managers are wonderful in their attempts to keep customers happy with such outdated accommodations.  Days Inn should update their facilities and pay their managers what they deserve.  The managers were the only bright spots of my last two stays.

Summary Heading: This property is badly in need of a renovation. In the...
Summary: This property is badly in need of a renovation. In the suite we used, the bathroom door did not close, paint was coming off in the bathroom and fixtures were aged. Electric outlets throughout the suite would not hold a plug; they slipped back out. There were large spaces between the heating/cooling unit and the wall and between outside door and frame. Wall-mounted light switch motion sensors were punched in and did not operate.

Summary Heading: The most horrible bed I have ever tried to sleep on.
Summary: Do not stay at Days Inn.  Although our room was somewhat clean, the beds were of such poor quality and so hard that it was impossible to sleep.  The breakfast was a joke with stale sweet rolls, dried out cereal and unrefrigerated milk.  it was set up on a very small table that did not look clean.  When I checked in and out the clerks were not friendly, slow and disinterested.  When I climbed the stairs to the second floor, I found at the top that I had  to climb over the vacuum cleaner that the cleaning person had abandoned along with the cleaning cart, it could have been a very dangerous situation for someone who was not sure-footed.  I will never stay at a Days Inn again.

Summary Heading: Stunk like dead rat in the old outdated restroom.  The...
Summary: Stunk like dead rat in the old outdated restroom.  The bedroom smelled awful as well.  Covers were drabby. Only his thing was the pillows. Made reservations for nonsmoking, I get there , they didn't have any rooms left, ccouldnt find my reservation.

Barely passable hotel with clean enough rooms, I guess. Breakfast was as simple and cheap as you could get (generic instant oatmeal, cup noodles, toast a cold cereal were offered).  Owner or manager standing outside office smoking (yuk), drippy faucet, weird clock that made noises for no reason, construction nearby that starts at 7 am. Bulb out in one of the fixtures.  Pillows were awful and i am so glad i brought my own. If I were paying $59 a night I would expect this, but at $100 a night I would expect better. Woman at the front desk was friendly enough and tried to address my concerns. Housekeeping did come in and bring fresh towels, made beds, etc. every day. Parking was free and convenient.
It was very noisy in the am you could hear people upstairs walking around and people walking outside the door.

This was the biggest waste of $99.00 I have ever done in my life, the bed was as hard as the floor, bath tub was in bad repair, and our room had a roach in it, so my wife made us leave immediately, and the man in the office did not even care.

If you like dirty rusty showers, electrical outlets don't work, hair dryers that are bolted to the walls and don't work....There is NO pride by the owner of this hotel. Management and owners are CHEAP CHEAP CHEAP...outdated, dirty, noisy, no pool, hospital down the street, ambulances sirens all day and night.....need I say more?
Manager Response: Hi Patrick,  I apologize for the negative experience you have had here.  We understand your frustrations and are working toward your concerns to make traveling with us a better experience.  We realize trust is gained and we will continue to work hard to be the "Best Value Under the Sun" t.m. while you are traveling through Orange, CA.  Please message me with your private booking information and details at your convenience, I would like to look into your stay personally with us and ensure these items are corrected.  Thank you,  Days Inn - Orange Management.

Summary: I was very upsset at the service. I usually enjoy days inn, but really want a refund, they served raman noodles as the continental breakfast. Staff was unhelpful and room was dirty, disorganized, A/C did not work.
Manager Response: Hi Jessica,  I apologize for the negative experience you have had here.  We understand your frustrations and are working toward your concerns to make traveling with us a better experience.  We realize trust is gained and we will continue to work hard to be the "Best Value Under the Sun" t.m. while you are traveling through Orange, CA.  Please message me with your private booking information and details at your convenience, I would like to look into your stay personally with us and ensure these items are corrected.  Thank you,  Days Inn - Orange Management.

Summary: I have stayed in pretty bad hotels.... but this topped it. I actually left after an 1.5 hr in the room. I asked for a refund and none was given. The couch had residue on it. Electrical was bad.. it shocked me. Had to fight with the wifi, tv, mini fridge. I will NEVER stay at another Days Inn.
Manager Response: Hi Nur1991,  I apologize for the negative experience you have had here.  We understand your frustrations and are working toward your concerns to make traveling with us a better experience.  We realize trust is gained and we will continue to work hard to be the "Best Value Under the Sun" t.m. while you are traveling through Orange, CA.  Please message me with your private booking information and details at your convenience, I would like to look into your stay personally with us and ensure these items are corrected.  Thank you,  Days Inn - Orange Management.

Summary: The room had a strange oder and the bathroom was not clean, the maid never came our first day we had to hunt her down for clean towels.
Manager Response: Hi Kirsten B,  I apologize for the negative experience you have had here.  We understand your frustrations and are working toward your concerns to make traveling with us a better experience.  We realize trust is gained and we will continue to work hard to be the "Best Value Under the Sun" t.m. while you are traveling through Orange, CA.  Please message me with your private booking information and details at your convenience, I would like to look into your stay personally with us and ensure these items are corrected.  Thank you,  Days Inn - Orange Management.

Summary: The bed was hard. I had to pay for an extra day. Barely had television channels. Bathroom  was okay. Service was terrible.

Switched from smoking to non-smoking which required an "upgrade" charge of $10 because of different room type.  Seems a bit much.  Was asked to pay the $10 in cash instead of adding to my credit card.

We found a cheap room during Valentine's day weekend so we knew it wasn't going to be great but this was awful. First off the front desk woman Eva was absolutely horrible. She actually yelled at us for asking if they had a non smoking since we accidentally booked smoking. Then shooed us out of the lobby for apparently taking too long. Room needed renovation along with the whole hotel. Continental breakfast was bread and juice. Never recommend this place to anyone and very disappointed with Days Inn franchise for allowing such poor hotel service and rotten building.

Summary Heading: Wel it can be more afordtibal the red roof in it got better...
Summary: Wel it can be more afordtibal the red roof in it got better beds sorry but is true the parking lot was stand maybe they nned to power wash them one a week or every orter week get bertter blankets BEDS softer ones hot bearkfast for the peris not just cerial bagols come on realy

I had made a reservation for a non smoking room and when we got to the days inn on main street in orange, ca the lady at the desk said they only had smoking rooms and we had no choice. the tv remote didnt work at all. our room was freezing so we called down to get more blankets but no one would answer so we had to sleep in our jackets, while we were there for the 3 days our room never got cleaned the cleaning lady came to clean our room for the day at 7 pm at night when we were enjoying our dinner in the room. we asked them to please bring us another blanket cause we were so cold the night before and she said that she can only give us 1 sheet. when we went to check out my husband had asked the lady at the desk for her managers number and she insisted that there was no one higher

I always trip out when a place calls themselves an Inn & Suites when they are really just a motel.   In any case, for the price this motel was ok.  The front desk guy was not the friendliest person and the lobby smelled of cigarette smoke.  The a/c which wasn't very cold at all was really loud along with the random running toilet.  The room was somewhat clean.  The sheets were clean, but they felt like they had a residue on them.  The bathroom was a bit run down, could use a renovation.  The room had a microwave, a smelly fridge and coffee maker; none of which we used.  This is a really small building with a small parking lot, what I liked about the room was that it had windows on both sides of the room, that's how small the motel is.  We passed on the free breakfast which

The cooler did not work well. Kept blowing warm air so room was stuffy. On the last night  the fuse for the bathroom lights and outlet blew out. That happened around 2 am.  The little coffee pot that was in the room would not brew. Some other guest threw up in front of the room made it unpleasant to walk out when we were leaving. I am very dissatisfied with our visit and will not stay there again

Summary Heading: You get what you pay for.
Summary: This hotel didn't provide free wifi, and my room didn't have blinds- only curtains that didn't entirely close. Being on the bottom floor and traveling alone, I felt a little sketched out by that. The beds weren't very comfortable, but they weren't terrible. Also, there were no actual lights- just lamps! Everything was kept extremely clean, though, and I feel that the lack of luxury can just be attributed to the low price. It gave me a place to sleep, which was all I needed.. But the wifi and blinds on the windows are pretty essential, I think!

The location of days Inn is why we stayed as our daughter was to have surgery the next day at St. Joseph hospital. The Room was in bad shape or general disrepair. The cable/electrical covers loose and missing. The wall light did not work but I found that was due to being unplugged.  The air conditioning did not cool the air so it was miserable all night.  I tried to open the windows but they had no screens and no internal window lock the hotel had put screw security locks on so the windows opened half way and would not lock when shut. So if someone tried to break in they could just open the window and come in.   The noise level gets loud with the traffic pattern. The staff was great but the room was a bummer, not worth the money.
nice hotel for the price good location does need some maintenance had a electrical pug exposed next to the bed

Summary Heading: wi-fi internet didn't work in my part of the building
Summary: I reserved a non-smoking room.  When I checked in mid-evening, I was told they had no more of those, so they were upgrading me to a suite at no extra charge.  So far, so good.  But after I'd checked in and been in my room a little while, and found it unclear which of many secured internet points my computer was seeing was the hotels, I went to the lobby to ask for the password, and while giving to me, they said that in the room I'm in the wi-fi often doesn't work, but I'm welcome to bring my computer to the lobby and use it there.  And there was already someone else standing at the lobby desk using their laptop, so I guess I wasn't the only one.  Otherwise, the hotel was reasonable for an older Days Inn, though nothing more than you'd expect from a Days Inn (including very

I booked a hotel stay with Anaheim Days Inn Orange because we were going to need a suite.  WE NEVER ACTUALLY STAYED! We were staying at the Clarion the first night of our stay and wanted to check out the location of the Days Inn before we checked in. The hotel itself is in a seedy area with an empty dirty field behind it.  It is very outdated. There were indivuals coming out of the hotel who worried me.  I immediately called Days Inn to cancel our reservation.  After being on hold for an hour and a half I was finally helped.  I can say that after the hour and a half wait our reservations were canceled without charge, but don't be fooled by other Days Inn and Suites in the area. This one is nothing like the others.  For what I was being charged you can get a much better hotel

Summary Heading: Large comfortable room with fridge and micro, flat screen w/ 100 channels.
Summary: Big room, bed, tv at this small property.  Great location with easy freeway access for all points SoCal.  The room was pretty clean and the accomodations were nice, with a leather couch and huge bed, small work desk.  Really liked full channel line-up including Food, Golf, E, Comedy, etc.  Great bed, very comfortable.  Nice people on staff.

Average stay. Free breakfast was very limited but we didn't eat it anyway. Quiet hotel within walking distance to local stores. Some of the lights didn't work very well but mostly everything worked fine.

I stayed here for 4 nights whilst visiting a friend near by.  I booked it online in advance and my expectations of what it would be like were supassed.  My room was huge, the bathroom was pretty good, there was a fridge etc, a massive tv and the bed was huge and comfortable.  The location was pretty good, a few blocks from the centre of Orange and right opposite a 7-Eleven.  Also close by, within 10 minutes walking was a Carls Jr and a CVS, then a bit further was a huge Westfield.  Not the best place if you're solely on foot, although saying that there are frequent buses running nearby.    Internet was good and free.  Never got up in time to try the breakfast.  Overall a good hotel for the money.

We stayed at this motel for 3 nights. I would have checked out the 1st night except I would have lost my money. The room they gave us had a huge wet/smelly spot on the carpet, dried blood stains on the walls, no hot water or water pressure. The sink didn't drain. It was located on the main road and being an old building, it was loud. We got moved to a "suite" upstairs. Not much better, hard mattresses and couldn't sleep due to the noise of the traffic. The customer service was ok but the building was horrible.

Well, we stayed 2 nights and found the beds very comfortable. That's where the good stuff ends. We found the toilet to be loose on the floor and consequently the seal is compromised and it leaks out onto the floor. As with many motels, no one checks the drains in the sinks. This was also a problem. The sink needed a shot of good Drano. We also brought back some doggy bags from a restaurant to have later. We placed the food in the microwave oven to find that it did not work. It lit up, rotated the carousel but did not heat. Cold spaghetti is not my favorite. When morning came we found the "complimentary continental breakfast" to be non-existant. The office was locked as late as 7:15. This property shows signs of needing TLC to be a nice Days Inn. All in all, we should have stayed

Although the front of the hotel is not that inviting, I was pleasantly surprised of the interior of the room for the price we paid.  Only thing I disliked was that the windows did not shut/lock.  As we were on the second floor, I think it would have been hard for anyone to climb up.  Although the Days Inn website indicated that breakfast was included, it was hard to wake up the manager at 7:30 am in the morning to ask for breakfast.  All that was offered was coffee and packaged cinnamon rolls.  If we knew that we wouldn't have waited until then.  Also the ice machine did not work (and the feeling I got from the manager is that it didn't work for a long time and he didn't plan to get it fixed).
